pageContext.claim: “Arizona is a disaster in terms of the price increase in terms of insurance. 116 percent increase.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump cherry-picks the high end of premium increases, even though the average monthly premium across the country was up about 25 percent before subsidies. Trump also uses the calculation of premium increases without incorporating the impact of tax credits — which most people in the exchanges receive. If you take the subsidies into account, the average monthly premium of most people in the individual market exchange goes down, not up.
